bwwExcerpt: But the awe-struck descriptions of nature in ascendance are always secondary to what we're feeling, physically as well as emotionally. showScoreExcerpt:
"You might think that all this meta-rumination would impose an intellectual distance between us and the show’s main narrative. Yet we follow McIntyre into the jungles as eagerly as if we were children lost in an adventure novel...On its own, much of McBurney’s script has an old-fashioned romanticism, idealizing the elemental pureness of a Rousseauvian world. It’s much more the form than the content here that truly transports us into parts unknown."
